We drove up as high as we could - Mulholland Dr was blocked off to tourist traffic and there was literally no way to park and walk or anything. It was even really tough to turn around! Going up the hill you got glimpses here and there of the sign, but not a big, whole sign visible type view. Actually, before we started driving up the steep hill, we saw all sorts of people running out to the middle of the street to get pictures of the sign. column2: Take a drive thru the Hills

Although born in the flats of Los Angeles, as soon as I was out of college I ended up living in the Hills. There are lots of hilly areas---all of which which become more and more expensive the further WEST you go. . . until finally you are at the ocean. Having lived in most of the hills at one time or another, I have a long time perspective about all this and, of course, many of my friends still live in the Hollywood Hills area---so I'm there all the time. The area is always interesting, because its old and new HOLLYWOOD. . .and hiking there is nice, because its an old wooded area and the architecture is old for LOS ANGELES (few things prior to 1900) and better than the seedy urban scene of actual Hollywood. The older homes that are still there, can be built crazily into spaces no one could get away with building in TODAY what with earthquake and other laws. And there is ALWAYS a history of some sort to most of these homes---though not necessarily what some celebrity home map or tour bus driver tells you. Even if you aren't lucky enough to get to see a celebrity, if you drive the hills you will see interesting homes and get a sense of what Hollywood is and was always like. . .think Nathanial West's Day of the Locust---the book, not the film. In the more expensive hills (Beverly Hills, Brentwood) real estate developers and foreign buyers are tearing down the beautiful old homes and building what in my opinion, are ugly mega mansions. . .sometimes plain ugly modern boxes . . . sometimes the same "white house" design with 5500 square feet on a teeny lot. Hey, its all a matter of taste. But. . .before even Hollywood Hils become victimized, if you want to see what Los Angeles WAS really like. . .take a drive up there. . . because it could be gone before you know it. If you are a terrible drive, hire a car. And, if you find the park or a trail, do it BUT REMEMBER and understand that neighborhood/neighbors aren't happy if you drive like an idiot, take up all the parking and locals can't get to their homes because you don't know what you are doing. Pull over if you are having problems negotiating the road. And. . .IF you walk in the hills, know that its not a myth: there are rattle snakes, they are dangerous/poisonous, and they are ALWAYS there year round. The baby rattlers are more dangerous than the big ones. Hearing the rattle of a snake I could not see, while walking dogs off leash on a hike, was one of the single scariest moments of my existence. There are no bathrooms/water/anything and you probably want to do it early in the day. Spend an hour or two. . .or, just view the sign from far away and read some books on the subject. Its all good.

Nice drive and interesting things to look at and some to even envy around each twist and turn. Love the palm variety.

column2: Great drive around if you have few hours to spare in LA

column2: Gorgeous panoramic vista and healthy hike to the American flag behind the Hollywood sign
column3: We parked at Griffith park and hiked as close to the Hollywood sign. We kept going until my son pointed to the flag and the people by it above the Hollywood sign. We continued walking, followed people and met people coming back until we found the windy trail up.It was a great feeling to have reached the flag after relatively steep stretches of the windy trail! The 4 p.m. sun peeking behind the clouds with glorious rays coming through and glistening on the Pacific Ocean beyond LA was a gorgeous vista! Different parts of the trail had panoramic views of different areas of LA. Grass along the trail has this magnificent green color!My family members and I definitely enjoyed the hike together and all the people we hiked up and down with!The summit has only the flag and beautiful view in all directions. There is no water fountain and restrooms. Our decision to hike was spontaneous so we did not have water. It is advisable to have a bottle of water.

Took a Hollywood tour and went up mullholland drive, into the Hollywood hills, stopped at the Chinese theatres, drove in Beverly Hills, saw some celeb homes, and looked over the Hollywood bowl. Views of The surrounding hills and parts of LA from here.

Have lived in this area for more than 20 years. When picking someone up from the airport, I always take them up the 405 (north from LAX), get off on Mulholland, and then head east all the way across, so the visitor can see the views (south towards the ocean, Catalina, downtown LA and Beverly Hills, and north across the Valley). This drive is also great at night, for the views of all the city lights. Another great view is to take Laurel Canyon to Lookout Mountain (it's a T, so you can only turn west on Lookout), and then drive uphill, all the way to the top. When you reach the top, either take a hard, hairpin right at the stop sign, drive on for about two minutes, and you will get an amazing view of Beverly Hills and Century City and the ocean. OR, go straight through the stop sign, drive on for about 2 minutes, and you will get an incredible view of the ocean (looking east), DTLA, the Hollywood sign, and maybe even some giant tankers out on the ocean. GPS and cell signals may not work up here, so consider having an actual paper map to get you back out of there. Or, ask a friendly local walking by with their dog. Don't miss this! Aside from the views, seeing this vantage point will help you get your bearings in this giant city and understand what is where. There is no more sprawling, spread-out, and hard to comprehend city than this - only one I've seen that comes close is Johannesburg, South Africa.

great place! Nice and rich houses, great views, you can see the Hollywood Sign from different sides.

column2: Great place to drive and see, great views and great houses

Booked our tour through our concierge, great tour through the Canyon and Beverley Hills saw Hollywood sign too and houses of the stars, highly recommend.

column2: A Beautiful Place to Live in or Visit

Another place to check out in the LA area. It's interesting to see places you've seen in TV or in movies.

column2: On a sunny day a must

Just take a drive with the windows down and check out the interesting houses and the great views and be happy you don't have to pay $10 million per square inch for your own lovely home!
We took a starline tour from hollywood and thoroughly enjoyed it. Our guide not only pointed out the houses of the stars but took us to vantage points which were spectacular.

column2: One of those must do things!

An option to do while in LA. Really beautifull mansions along up and down hills. We moved around in car for a couple of hours.
One of the most beautiful places I have ever seen. The nature and the view to Los Angeles from the hills is unbelievable.

column2: You need ALOT of MONEY to live here!

It was really awesome to see the incredible house in the hills and the landscaping was really awesome, architecture was very interesting

column2: Would love to get upclose and drive around these hills!

column2: These semi step hills hide some luxury home So!

seeing the stars hotels was ok , cant really see too much but was worth the day out, can get a little hot sitting for a few hours

column2: Driving thru is like a roller coaster!

column2: A good rest from busy Hollywood Blvd!
column3: If you want to escape busy Hollywood Blvd Hollywood Hills are perfect place. Just few minutes walk away and you're in totally different place. Walking up the hill you can get to a lovely lake with Hollywood Sign nearby. Way better then crowded places.

If you live here, though, your neighborhood includes Hollywood Blvd, and if you have a dog, you'll be taking daily walks along inclines.

column2: Hollywood Tour and the Walk of Fame

We took a tour of the Homes of the Star's in an open air van (*Most Likely Illegal"), as our driver broke every traffic law and did 3 U-turns at speed to avoid police. While visiting relatives we had a chance to see the variety of house styles from to extremely large. You get to see history past and present. Seeing the little original house along side of the 2 or 3 story remodels is a sight to take in. Neighborhoods galore that need some tlc. Lots of homes with gingerbread trim and features.
The most beautiful views of LA are here. Get your camera ready and see for yourself the beauty of California.

column2: compulsary just to say you have been

Beautiful scenery, we did a tour that we just paid for through a company in Hollywood, seen the stars houses and drove up the hills,

column3: It is very much as mysterious as movies make it out to be but yet looks totally normal during the day. Its all hidden and you wont find anything unless your invited
not anything big to look at but makes you wonder how they did what they do to build those homes and the cost of them.
It's cool to get a picture of the Hollywood sign. It's famous but it's not all that glamours - be prepared for fog.

The Hollywood Sign is what you think of, when you think about LA. I was not disappointed, we saw it via the Holllywood Boulevard. If you go onto the third floor you can get great pictures. Or pay for a taxi to take you into the hills, you cant get right up close but you can get close enough for a decent photo.

column2: Tour bus to Hollywood signs and having fun
column3: I was on the tour bus starting from Hollywood walk of fame area about 1 1/2 hour tour, it's fun to see the sign again and again but the road is dusty and rocky sometimes (typical LA)
If you are looking to drive and see beautiful houses this is a good place to go. You really need to pay attention to driving as some of the places can be a challenge.

took this tour from Hollywood Blvd. It was an open air van, so you can see EVERYTHING , and take PLENTY of pictures. It was a GREAT 3 hour tour, with a few stops along the way to take some cool pictures. They driver was real knowledgeable about where the celebrities homes were. Highly recommend this tour, it was also, priced right. ENJOY IT
Just a bunch of houses sourrounded by a very dirty piece of land. Hollywood sign is just about to fall apart!
Great photo opportunities at this view point. Look at some of the spectacular villas that sit on the landscape. Very busy with tourists after mid morning but a great view of LA is on offer.

just take a walk and get lost trough the beautiful villas and experience a little bit of all over the world in one mountain. Some beautiful spanish style villas or the most beautiful home you ever dreamed of. Dont bother taking the car but you will need to drive up there.
If you are visiting LA and want to see lovely homes in the hills, this is one area that has both lovely homes and lovely views of the city, even access to the Hollywood sign.

column2: A Bit Hazy but LA is there somewhere
column3: Unfortunately the haze did limit what we could see of LA. Hopefully you might have better luck if you go there.

Our tour guide was a very knowledgeable guy but I guess that is there job to be so they are up on all the latest and who lives where. The trip we took was a half day tour which was enough but I thoroughly enjoyed it. They then drop you at the farmers market for lunch and they pick you up a couple of hours later and take you back to your accommodation.

Hollywood Hills has gorgeous homes that will make you eat your heart out. The tours through the area point out the famous that live there or have lived there in the past. Great tour and well worth the fare.
We took a guided tour of Hollywood and the Hollywood Hills. This was one of my favorite parts of the visit. The guide pointing out famous homes and the views were amazing

Interesting to drive through here, but you certainly can't stop and admire the view from up here very easily. Traffic now is unending. I don't know how the residents stand the congestion. Maybe the very rich can afford sound-deadening windows.

Great way to spend an hour driving around in the hills. You can get your star map and spot celebrity homes. The downside is so many twists and turns you get car sick. Cool stopping points for amazing LA views.Definitely still recommend. Cheap fun.

column2: An affluent and attractive area of LA
column3: We drove up around here on our way to Griffith Observatory. The Hollywood Hills are part of the Santa Monica Mountains. You get great views up here of Burbank and Universal Studios and of LA itself. You get to drive around some of the notable residents houses but you won't see anything other than fences. I would want privacy if I was them too. The famous Hollywood Bowl is up here and the John Ford Theaters. It is a very pleasant drive through an affluent area of the city.
Had so much i felt like a child again. So much to see and do. Great safe place for the family. Can catch the bus for 1 dollar
Nice hills surrounding LaLaLand! If you are lucky you can see more than fences surrounding great mansions!!
It's a bit of a trek but the view from the top is quite worth it. When the haze isnt to bad it's really great and at night all the lights are beautifull.

column2: Just a beautiful part of town.
column3: Now I know what everyone is talking about. Great architecture and just a pretty part of town. We biked through here but you have many tours or private tours to see this area!
This drive was an amazing experience. I would highly recommend it for scenic views and a fun relaxing day, especially if you like driving. We rented a convertible so it was especially fun.

column2: Just Do It & Hire a Tour Cab Driver ;-)!
column3: Terrific adventure, with many gorgeous spots to stop and GAZE!If you've been before, then drive yourself.If first time; hire a private tour car. You won't regret it & it's really not that expensive, considering the time you'll save & loads of information w/ stops @ your request!Just breathtaking views and awesome scenery! Only in LA!!
Take a drive around the Hollywood Hills. there are all types of architecture and some places have incredible views over Los Angeles. It is well worth the drive and time.

column2: Loved Getting Close Up To The Hollywood Sign
column3: While driving aroung this area one day I decided to follow my nose and try and get as close as I could to the Hollywood sign. My GPS wasn't much help as it took me miles up a road that eventually turned into a 'closed road' So finally with twists and turns I got as close to the sign that was legally possible. Do not try and climb the hill to get closer- there are security guards at the top, who have loud speakers if you dare try and try to warn you off and if you heed their warnings, the police helicopter will soon be deployed and come swooping overhead as it did the day we were there. There locals must get tired of the constant cruising of cars trying to negotiate their way around hairpin bends on what we call the wrong side of the road. But really, I don't think a local could expect anything less when you are living in the shadows of something so iconic in LA- in the world really. I couldn't tell you the street name to get you there because it was a complete blind adventure, but I had fun and got some awesome photos.

column2: The views gave us a perspective of the size of parts of LA
column3: We took a tour up around the hills. Although we enjoyed being there (to say we've done it) it's really no different than other cities with houses on hills. The views down towards Los Angeles gave us a good perspective on the size of the city.
Hollywood Hills, Los Angeles, CA - spectacular views, home to the Griffith Observatory and beautiful homes and architecture. A must see on your visit to Los Angeles.

I enjoyed the hike to see the Hollywood sign, but you cannot get that close to the Hollywood sign:( My friend and I used the Mount Hollywood Trial and that does not get you that close, but you can still get good pictures of the sign from a distance.
Take a tour into Hollywood Hills to see the movie stars homes. You can always go back later on your own to see if you can spot a star on your own.
Hollywood is great, but seeing it live doesn't do anything for it. Unless you go to the studios or know a celebrity to let you in their gigantic house...who cares?
You have to see the Hills if you are in Hollywood. You would have missed out on what the "other side" live like.
so much has changed in 25yrs. not like it used to be but the views are still nice overlooking the city. it was better when i knew people and could sit out and gaze for hours.

column2: HOllywood is one great place to visit.
column3: If I told you I was tied up and left behind the letter H in the Heollywood Hills would you believe me? well I was. My fraternity did that to me and some others. we each had a letter.But the Hills themselves are outstanding and the homes are great to see. the view from the top looks oatut over LA and Hollywood itself.Yes, they do tours of the stars homes and it is a trip you should do once.they know the homes and you ,even with a map will not find most of the places.I loved living in Hollywood and going to schools here.Great places to see,shop,eat.

column2: cross your inger and hope to see a celeb
column3: We went on a tour to see the celebrity homes in the Hollywood Hills. I didn‚Äôt want to drive so we took the tour and was that a mistake. The bus driver whisked around so fast that we couldn‚Äôt see the homes and if we did, it was for just a few seconds. I took note of the route and drove by in my rental car and did the whole thing by ourselves. Don‚Äôt take a tour and just go yourself. It is a bit stressful but with a good copilot is is very doable and then you can get out and walk around.
We took a tour through the Hollywood Hills and made several stops at houses were Hollywood actors lived. Was very cool!

column2: Wouldnt miss this tour for anything
column3: Awesome views and stunning place to visit. The long winding roads and the houses are incredible. You are always looking out for someone you might recognise, very scenic and exciting place to be
Great way to spend an hour driving in the Hollywood Hills, up to the sign. The kids had fun and we got a few great pictures!

You wanna see how the better half lives? Where here it is. Lovely views of LA and celebrities homes everywhere... I just hoped while I was driving around that they are all donating a lot to charity because it is overwhelming... the extravagance and opulence is just too much. Not my thing.

column2: good place to get a pic with the hollywood sign
column3: did a quick tour with the car, it takes copule of hours to see the houses and the view from the hills,has some good places to stop and to take a picture with the hollywood sign in the background.
first time in LA......you need to get the iconic photo done for your album. bieber to russian oligarchs to katy perry......you get to see their gates and possibly a front door

column2: It is Holywood....... take a picture with the sign cherish your visit.
column3: Something should not miss when visit to Hollywood, LA. Since My son was very small at that time we didn't went closer to the sign, but can see the sign from the Kodak theater.
Funny how many times you see it in the movies yet to be at the foot of the hills of the big sign did seem real but photos don't lie. Now we have a part of Hollywood of our own.
Great view of the city. Roads were little curvy but worth the drive. Great tour of the homes of the rich and famous.
A must see. A great thing to do is just drive around the hills and marvel at the views, the quirky roads and the homes. Respect all the signs though....
Great place to visit when you are in Hollywood as its a monument known all over the wold and the hills are spectacular for views

This was truly a dream trip come true. I had won a trip to Ellen's 12 days of giveaways but my 14 year old daughter was too young to go with me. SO SAD. I won enough points from Orbitz on the Giveaways that I was able to fulfill her dream to travel California.
Love love love, I'm loving the hills. Take your camera with you. If you love architecture you will take lots of photos. And maybe you will see someone famous also.

column2: One of those have to have been there places
column3: Nice view over LA and one of those places you just have to have been at. We drove up to the Getty Center (1200 Getty Center Drive, Los Angeles) to enjoy the view. Nice place to do so. Free restrooms, free parking (although very limited spaces for the crowds it attracts) and free WiFi.
Nice view from the top, scary narrow road with loads of tour buses parking everywhere , but I still think it was worth the drive

Gosh! Its easier said than done!! Going down was fine then we realised we had to haul ourselves back up so, weaklings that we are, we went downwards for about 1 hour then dragged ourselves back up as we could not do the whole route. Parking at the top is limited and depending on the weather, the views lovely. Frymans Canyon (off Ventura) is easier.

column2: To see how the rich live
column3: My wife and I enjoyed the drive across this place, to see the large and expensive houses. We viewed the home of Will Smith and the huge Hefner residence from the street.
It is nice to drive around in the hills to see the houses. there are some really nice ones. The view from the top is pretty nice also.
Nice tour around movie star neighborhood. Awesome views make it even funnier.If you feel like you need to watch and stalk celebrities then that's your place to visit!

column2: Poor cell coverage, long distances and Brad Pit
column3: Its the Hollywwod hills, drive Mulholland drive from the 101 or take Laurel Canyon or one of the other canyons. You prob want to explore a little if you are a tourist and you can. Poor cell coverage and the distances are longer than they seem on the map. Dont stop where the Starline busses stop, they have no clue where Brad Pit lives.
Take your time and drive the area - up and down. If you can snag an invite to the Magic Castle - don't miss it.
We were underwhelmed by the Hollywood sign that we drove around up in the hills to see if there was another bigger more impressive sign. It was interesting seeing all the houses though.

I absolutely loved the views of the Hollywood Hills from the city as you have a better perspective on how majestic they are as well as very charming. The Hollywood sign is obviously very cool and iconic but unless you have a good zoom, dont expect too much!
I never grow tired of driving through here it is just so beautiful all the hills and houses it really is amazing. a definite to do on your visit to the LA area.
We did a tour that included this area it was great fun seeing the stars houses and the view was fantastic from up here

This was one of the things I absolutely had to cross off my list before I left the LA area, and although I didn't expect a lot going in, I thoroughly enjoyed it. The drive up was a little more than we were used to, but parking was easy to find. The view was absolutely majestic, and it was nice just being away from it all and looking over the city. There's not a whole lot more to say, but if you are just visiting LA, stop by Hollywood and try this.

column2: A nice drive with beautiful view of the city
column3: Someone I know rents a house there and I have been to her house a few time. The view of the city is nice and the area is quiet.
Amazing views and scenery, the houses are truly breath taking. Just a short drive from the hustle & bustle of Hollywood.
Drove thru here on our way looking for the hollywood sign very large beutiful impressive homes wow and great views of Hollywood and santa monica

column2: Hike, bike, segway, views and history
column3: We segwayed around the hills for a couple hours and had ball. It is was a good half day escape high above the city. Bring a lunch and a map and relax.

A great view of the houses on the hills and the famous sign as well as the view of downtown below. The roads are very slow though because of the twists and turns so allow yourself plenty of time and enjoy the view.
We drove through the Hollywood Hills when we were in town and it was fun and nice to see the different homes and the Hollywood sign. If you have a car or can swing it, drive around and check it out!

column2: Hollywood Hills Sparkle in the Early Morning Light
column3: On our first drive through the scenic Hollywood Hills, we had optimal views of downtown Los Angeles, Griffith Observatory and the breathtaking sunset. On our most recent visit, I discovered the beautiful views of the Hollywood Hills with the rays of the sunrise reflecting off the windows of the homes and mansions dotting the Hollywood Hills. This glimpse very early on this California morning kept me outside enjoying the unusual sparkle of glistening windows in the early light as the sun rose over the lush green Hollywood Hills. Beautiful.

column2: A great way to spend an afternoon
column3: We passed through the hills on an earlier tour we had booked and wanted to go back.We spent the afternoon just driving round looking at all the houses. It's a lovely drive and the properties you see are simply breathtaking

column2: Great place to see the Hollywood sign
column3: We viewed the Hollywood Hills from The Griffith Observatory. It seems despite an early morning start it was packed with many others wanting to see the Hollywood sign from that vantage point. Great views and great photo opportunities.
What a cool drive! This is a great way to spend some time driving though gorgeous scenery and viewing spectacular mansions.

I'm an architect and the Hollywood Hills are excellent to see how the mid-level of the entertainment industry lives. Some of the houses are very dumpy and tired looking 60s affairs. Others are over the top and garish, while some are simply beautiful works of modern architecture. Since L.A. is so trend conscious, the current fads really come out in the styles of the houses. Unlike, say, Beverly Hills, where last decades design miscalculations are ripped away with another expensive remodel or teardown. Worth a look if you only walk up a few blocks from Sunset Blvd.

column2: Beautiful Homes and the Hollywood Sign
column3: We walked up to The Griffith Observatory and the view of the Hollywood Hill is stunning. Beautiful modernist and old homes, and The Hollywood Sign as a bonus
We stayed in the Hollywood Hills. Loved every moment. The greenery, the homes, the view... Whether you stay there or get a hop on hop off bus or a tour bus the hills are just gorgeous
The Hollywood hills are win wins:if you are looking up from Hollywood then the iconic sign is there to see, and if you go up to the hills, you get to see the Los Angeles basin. Everyone's a winner!

column2: Great day of three different types of adventure!
column3: The old and grand homes on the way up to the observatory are beautiful testaments to the glory of the time in which they were built and make for beautiful photos! One can spend an entire day in the Griffith Observatory exploring the wonders of the stars and space. The hiking beginning at the observatory offers spectacular views of the region and great people watching.

We drove through this neighborhood to get to the observatory. This place has really beautiful old mansions practically hanging off the mountain side. The greenery is fantastic as well worth a little drive around for sure.

Took our own tour of this fascinating neighborhood of Hollywood Hills. It is amazing how this mansions are built on these cliffs. Stilts on the back side.We saw ElvisPresley's Mansion,Paul Newman's,Barbara Stanwick, Micky Rooney's, I think there is more but can't remember.Many years have passed but so enjoyed visiting here.

Had a couple hours before flight from LAX back to Wisconsin. Drove up to the Hollywood Hills by the Griffith Observatory. View was amazing, seeing the sign was amazing. Only thing not good was the restrooms. We just got back from Mexico and the toilets were far superior in Mexico than in the Hills. Would have liked to stay longer but had to catch a plane.

Amazing vistas from "The Hills"...downtown Los Angeles views; the houses in the Hills seemingly "hang" from the "cliffs" they're built on. We toured the Hills and other popular places in LA with relatives involved in the movie and song, screen writing business.....an "insiders" take on the Hills.....Imagine streets narrow to the point that an emergency vehicle such as a fire truck cannot access some of the homes there because of the narrowness of the streets. Fires are dealt with there using helicopters....It's totally worth your time to check out the homes in "The Hills"...you'll wonder how those homes were "nailed" to the sides of cliffs and other outcroppings...I understand it takes 45 minutes to drive down to the local market to grocery shop....trips are planned accordingly...

We stayed with relatives who live in Los Felix and you can see the Hollywood sign when you walk around Griffith Park.Bottom line its a sign and we were in the right place to see it but I wouldn't drive specially to see it

This is a whole other world, we are talking 1 million pounds wouldnt get you far, but its a must see, its a whole different lifestyle, the homes are stunning and the cars are magnificant I was lucky enough to visit a mansion in the hills and it was out of this world, go take a look!

I had the pleasure of being in the passenger seat and enjoying the sights along Mulholland Drive and the rest of the hills. Although hearing about all of the stars who live here is interesting, the beauty and calm of being in the Hills is unmatched. It is best to enjoy this sight as a PASSENGER! LOL...The roads are winding, the hills are steep, and a mis-judged turn could take you off a very steep cliff! Otherwise, a very beautiful place and a great place to imagine living the "lifestyles of the rich and famous!"
All the reviews talk about drivingthrough the hills. Either the driver isn't enjoying the sights or he is endangering others. Get out of those cars, people!
We enjoyed driving around the hills and looking at the different types of materials/architecture used in this area. There are some viewpoints you can park you car at and take some pictures.
Me and my friends went for a drive around the Hollywood Hills - It has some incredible views and beautiful houses. Free to do and a bit of fun. Definitely worth it

Great views and fantastic place just to drive though to see how the other half live. get a few addresses of the stars in the satnav and go house spotting also. its open and the roads wind round as you go through the famous mullholland drive.
we drove up into the Hollywood hills and stopped at one of the areas for cars at the top, the view was fantastic, great to see all the fabulous houses,

column2: Hollywood hills shine on the sun
column3: Most recognisable place in the world, highly recommended for newcomers to US. Amazing feelings and stunning views.
Good place for driving through. Some great vantage points from which to see the city and some impressive homes that I'll never be able to afford, but can still admire. Definitely worth a visit.
Hollywood hills are probably my favourite place to view the skyline of downtown la as well as the san fernando valley. Mulholland drive can not be missed !

We opted to stay in the Hollywood Hills away from all of the hustle and bustle and I'm very glad we did. The Hills afford breathtaking views, access to nature, tranquility, easy access to Hollywood, mystery, glamour and not to mention affordability. We rented a home facing Mulholland Dr. with 180 degree canyon and city views. We also had a nice view of the Hollywood sign and were in short walking distance to Runyon Canyon. We thoroughly enjoyed the area and loved that we only had a 5 minute drive down to Hollywood Blvd. When I go back to LA I will definitely stay there again.

column2: Good for a quick drive through
column3: It's impressive to us folks from back east to see houses built like this. The views are pretty and the houses can be impressive, as well. Our drive just took us for a quick spin through here and it was neat, but wouldn't go out of my way to see it.
If you have extra time while in L.A. Take your car into the Hollywood hills the roads are very narrow but the views are spectacular and the homes run the gambit from small to spectacular

To get up into the Hollywood Hills we took Nichols Canyon Road and snaked upwards until we came to Mulholland Drive. There we encountered the tour buses so we knew we were on the right track. We went past houses both ostentatious and modest but most of the time the roads were so narrow and winding we weren't able to take photos. California was in the midst of a terrible drought so everything was parched. Much of the landscape was just stark bare hills dotted with chaparral. We saw some homes of the stars - beautiful places with multiple rooms, sprawling gardens and elegant pools. We came back down Mulholland Drive until we reached Laurel Canyon Road and then took West Sunset Boulevard heading towards the coast. We did a detour up Beverley Hills Drive until we could go no further and this and Bel Air were more what I'd always imagined the homes of the rich in LA were like. There were old trees shading roads, manicured hedges, ornate gates barring entry to obviously well-kept, multi-storey houses. The dwellings are in all types of architecture. We saw plenty of Spanish- and German-style houses, and then also some weird modern designs. If you're going to LA a trip into the hills is a must-see in my book.

column2: The Hollywood Hills is a residential neighborhood...
column3: That hates tourist driving through it. So much so that they call the police when people park on there street. Tickets are given. You have been warned.

We enjoyed driving through the hills. The views were spectacular and the homes were impressive. You need to be very careful as the streets are narrow and sometimes there are blind corners. This is a high traffic area so slow down.

column2: Excellent Views if the Weather is Good
column3: This is an interesting area and well worth a visit if you are in the area and have a car, as the hills are steep and there is a lot of area to cover. The view on a clear (NON Smog) Day are fantastic and at night even better. You can see some pretty amazing homes in this area and not all of them are owned by Movie Stars as a mater of fact very few are. During certain area you can see how really big the Hollywood sign is. THIS IS A SELF DRIVE/WALK tour.

We desided to walk all the way from Beachwood Dr, up the hills to get as close to the sign as possible. There are some steep hills so you should where some comtable shoes. We made it up to the Senic View point at Lake Hollywood Park. The view was amazing. It was cool to se all the houses to normal peope that lives in the Hollywood Hills, not only the rich and famous. We did stumble over the formal house of Madonna, and Asthon Kutchers house, that was cool. We did walk down to the Hollywood Reservoir the walk all the way around. It was a bit longer then we expected so bring a small backpack with water and some snacks!! We finally made it down to the Hollywood Blvd. My girlfriend almost fainted becouse of the heat and the lack of wather, so water is very important.

Loved the views although I am afraid of heights. It was amazing how the houses sit in the hills, I couldn't live there but it was nice. The drive up was terrifying, the people drive like maniacs and so did the tour bus driver.

Great views, however the roads are extremely narrow and winding, you almost feel as if you are intruding on the residents and it can be difficult if another car is coming in the opposite direction. Great to see and worth the time, definitely wouldn't attempt if your a nervous driver not experienced with driving on the opposite side of the road in that instance it would be better to take the tour bus.

column2: Nice to try at least once
column3: Amazing views and scenery, but the locals drive recklessly on the slim roads that allow only one car to drive through w the steep hills and sharp curves you can't see whats coming at you ahead. Make sure you have full coverage car insurance and health insurance as well travelling through the Hollywood Hills. My family traveled through this area for a view of the Hollywood sign. It was nice to drive through the area at least once.
Good to get away from the city and get some rest and have a nice view of both the Los Angeles city and Hollywood sign

column2: Lots to see but you must be a brave driver.
column3: Pick up a map of "stars" homes and get started. You'll probably find a few dead ends and steep hills, but it's worth the effort. Take the road up to Mullholland Drive -- the views are amazing. A GPS is a must!

If you do visit LA, you're gonna wanna take a drive up there.The houses are stunning as you would expect, the view is amazing and we actually had to go twice because there so many small roads that it's hard to remember where you have already been and where you haven't.The thing that bothered me was the condition of the roads, with loose asphalt and a lot of pot holes. but then again, the drive is definitely worth the view.

column2: Big pretty houses, that's all folks
column3: If you're into living vicariously through the rich and famous, you might really get off on this. Otherwise, you will find the experience pretty boring and quickly realise you are just looking at a bunch of garage doors. There are views out over Los Angeles occasionally which are nice, but nothing to write home about due to the smog.I would recommend finding a list of famous people's addresses online (or buying in LA) and conducting your own tour if you have a car. Alternatively, you can do tours but they are pretty expensive for what you get.
Nice view of the city from the hills and took a picture with the Hollywood sign. Nothing much to do around head back to the city for action

Take a drive through the Hollywood Hills and see beautiful homes, and even some innovative architecture. Amazingly, most of these gorgeous residences seem unoccupied, except for gardeners! If I could own a home like that I would be in it all the time. Some houses are hard to see and it's best driven in a vehicle high off the ground. Wonderful views, trees, shrubs and flowers. It's like living in a park - but why does no one seem to be living and enjoying it?

Hollywood we said we must go there. Ok we went there but what a total let down. It was nothing awe imagine huge villas yes. All within their high fences. We the hollywoodcsign from behind. All my romanticized ideas of the glam and glitter dashed . I wouldn't waste time going there again. L.A. has so much more to offer.

This has been on my bucket list for quite some time. I was able to cross it off this past 4th of July. The area feels like you're in the movie "Pleasantville." Perfectly manicured lawns, gorgeous houses, nice cars in the driveway. My friends and I did get lost trying to find the way to the hills. We could see the sign, but it was not easy getting to it like we had thought. We ended up venturing through this Pleasantville neighborhood (which was exciting to walk through so the time flew by).Me and my girlfriends aren't the most athletically inclined, but we were able to walk up the hill with no problem. As you can see by my picture, the sign is extremely teeny unless you are able to get up very close (which will be a LOT of walking/climbing).My recommendation: Climb the hills before sunrise or after sunset. Will be a lot cooler. And bring lots of water!

column2: Bob Seger said it best "..high rolling hills "
column3: We did the Mulholland Drive rride from the vicinity of the Hollywood Bowl over to Laurel Canyon .The ride was very enjoyable .The scenery is vantastic .We had previously taken a tour which had identified some celeb houses .It was nice to drive at a slow pace and enjoy the views .Highly recommend taking the drive .

column2: Glad we went for a look
column3: We used the dog walking site zip code and took a nice drive through the hills early one Sunday morning before leaving LA. You can tell the residents are sick of it with all the signs. We stopped off to take a photo once we reached the dog walk area, there are some rocks that you can stand on and create a photo like you are holding the Hollywood sign, across the road I'm sure on a clear day the views over the city would be spectacular (it was cloudy while we were there). Nothing much around there as you would expect like a toilet so on the way down we stopped off at a Starbucks for a break.

For whoever likes hiking, this is one the the trails that you will end up doing sooner or later. It is not the hardest or prettiest trail you'll ever do, but it will take you to have a closer view of the world famous Hollywood sign and a wider view of the Los Angeles city (hopefully, if the smog permits).When I did the trail I came back through an almost lost small out of the map trail. It made my hike even more fun. However, it can be a little dangerous due to a few steep ways. Anyway, just being closer to the nature, sunshine and sand, for whoever likes it, should be good enough to give it a try.

Definitely take a drive up the Hollywood Hills. You can get close to the Hollywood sign to take a pic, see star homes and see Mulholland Drive. No lights at night so go during the day. It has breathtaking views of the Valley.

column2: Winding Roads to the Famous Hollywood Sign
column3: I was surprised that so many nice homes are lining the streets that are so narrow with so many curves. I guess that is part of the history as these roads and many homes must be pretty old. Eventually you'll get to some really nice viewing areas of the sign. You'll never really get that close but a good place to park is just path the dog park. Of course with a good camera you do not need to drive into the hills to get a great picture. The sign is visible from many locations around the area. A good spot for viewing the sign is in Griffith Park at the Observatory.

Don't try to go to the sign. It looks better from a distance anyway. the local are fed up with tourist and will sick they're gardener on you, Nothing really to see. all the houses are blocked from view and you can't ever see anyone. easy to get lost. waste of time.

Surely worth seeing.. not much there.. just loads of hills and this one famous sign.. but still i loved it.. just the fact of being there and seeing it myself.. and a beautiful houses all around.. just not really understand why people would want to live there.. surely it would not be my choice if I would be rich... ;)

The views from the Hollywood Hills of the Los Angeles basin and to the ocean are one of the best features of the Hills. At night, they are spectacular. There are lots of gorgeous homes in the area, too, many of which have been and still are inhabited by famous movie stars. And you can't forget the Hollywood sign that is so iconic to Los Angeles. I am a native and while I don't live there, on a clear day I can see all the way to that sign from my upstairs bedroom and smile.

It is idyllic, especially at dusk. But you almost have to be back from it a bit, because when you are in it, there is luch canopy of trees obscuring most of the view around you. And in places, the roads are very, very narrow in some areas, with not many places to stop or park along some of the streets. But there are moments when it seems like something out of a fantasy book, looking at these homes clinging to hillsides, with modern lighting that gives everything a surrealistic appearance. Note: There are no stores, or shops, or other attractions to visit... these are private residences in charming neighhborhoods.

There's really not much to "do" in Hollywood Hills. My recommendation is to just hop in your car and take off up the winding hills. The houses and the views are unforgettable -- and the only thing you have to pay for to look is the gas. A cheap and memorably "LA" thing to see if you're visiting.
